multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: equities and inflation; Taylor Swift’s upcoming album releases, tour, and limited‑time merchandise are likely to lift US consumer spending, boosting the S&P 500 by 0.5‑2% over the next 3‑6 months and nudging US inflation up 0.1‑0.3% in the same window.

article_node.title: Taylor Swift has become a Beanie Baby, turning from a celebrity into an economy of her own
article_node.summary: The article examines how Taylor Swift has transformed herself into a commodified brand, using limited‑time releases, scarcity tactics, and parasocial fan engagement to drive continuous consumer spending. It compares her strategy to historical collectibles like Beanie Babies, noting how her marketing creates a sense of scarcity and exclusivity that fuels fan obsession. While acknowledging her financial success and avoidance of public scandals, the piece questions whether her bubble will eventually burst, highlighting the broader dynamics of celebrity-driven consumerism in the digital age.
